#MYC4 is another example of #crowdfunding and how groups are reaching out globally and attracting interest in common projects and goals.

An Indiegogo #crowdfunding campaign was started called T160K. The campaign raised over $67K in flexible funding with a goal of $100K.

In 2012, when Al-Qaeda occupied the north of Mali, precious transcripts from Timbuktu were evacuated to the capital, Bamako.
You will even more surprised to learn that #Crowdfunding is so effective, it happens in a place as remote as Timbuktu.
Most people think Timbuktu is a fictional place. Timbuktu is a city in the West African nation, Mali known for its extreme inaccessibility.
"From here to Timbuktu" Most likely you or someone you know has used this phrase to describe a long, difficult journey at least once. Right?

Investors can invest in one or as many businesses as they wish (manually or auto-bid) with an entry amount of only €5. #MYC4
When the businesses passes due diligence, they are uploaded onto the #MYC4 Platform for funding.
The #MYC4 marketplace is built around a network of local providers (MFIs) who screen the local businesses looking for a loan.
It is typically small and medium sized enterprises (SMEs) that cannot borrow money to develop business, create jobs and formalize. #MYC4
In Africa, more than 380 million people have no access to funding, which is a challenge for Africa’s growth and prosperity... #MYC4
#MYC4 platform facilitates the exchange of loan capital from investors around the world directly with African micro and small enterprises.
We enable people from all over the world to connect directly with African entrepreneurs who lack capital to develop their businesses. #MYC4
We aim to remove the financial barrier that significantly contributes to underdevelopment of businesses in Africa. #MYC4
Business must be for a profit, but profit must be for a purpose. #MYC4
MYC4 is an online marketplace that was launched  to create long-term and sustainable economic growth... #MYC4
